enum.comment: The motion patterns that need specific stiffness settings

data.comment: This interface provides acces to basic humanoid motion patterns.
data.field: True if the robot is currently moving.
Maximum length of a footstep in m.
Maxium height of a footstep cycloid in m.
Maximum length of side step in m.
Maximum change around vertical axis on radians per footstep.
Zero moment point offset in forward direction in m.
Zero moment point offset in sideward direction in m.
Amplitude in degrees of backlash compensation for left hip roll. This is fitted to the Nao and is possibly not applicable to other robots.
Amplitude in degrees of backlash compensation for left hip roll. This is fitted to the Nao and is possibly not applicable to other robots.
Height of hip during walk process. This is fitted to the Nao and is possibly not applicable to other robots.
Torso orientation in degrees in sideward direction during walking. This is fitted to the Nao and is possibly not applicable to other robots.
If true the arms are controlled during walking for balancing.
Median in radians of the shoulder pitch during walking.
Amplitude of the shoulder pitch movement during walking.
Median in radians of the elbow roll during walking.
Amplitude of the elbow roll movement during walking.
The ID of the message that is currently being processed, or 0 if no message is being processed.

message.name: SetWalkParams
message.comment: Allows for setting certain walking parameters. Values that have a magic value of -1234567 are ignored.

message.name: SetWalkArmsParams
message.comment: Allows for setting certain walking parameters related to using the arms for balancing. Values that have a magic value of -1234567 are ignored.

message.name: WalkStraight
message.comment: Orders the robot to walk on a straight line.
message.field: Number of intermediate samples to use for walking.

message.name: WalkSideways
message.field: Number of intermediate samples to use for strafing.

message.name: WalkArc
message.comment: Orders the robot to walk on an arc.
message.field: Angle in radians to turn over the way.
Radius in m of the circle in m.
Number of intermediate samples to use for walking.

message.name: Walk
message.comment: Orders the robot to walk in the given direction (or stop if 0)
message.field: Fraction of MaxStepX. Use negative for backwards. [-1.0 to 1.0]
Fraction of MaxStepY. Use negative for right. [-1.0 to 1.0]
Fraction of MaxStepTheta. Use negative for clockwise [-1.0 to 1.0]

message.name: Turn
message.comment: Orders the robot to turn on the current position.
message.field: Number of intermediate samples to use for turning.

message.name: Kick
message.comment: Kick with a robot's leg, for instance a ball.

message.name: Park
message.comment: Bring robot into a park position where it is safe to turn servos off.
message.field: Time in seconds when to reach the position.

message.name: GetUp
message.comment: Bring robot into a standing position when in park position.
message.field: Time in seconds when to reach the position.

message.name: Standup
message.comment: Bring robot into a standing position when lying on the ground.

message.name: YawPitchHead
message.comment: Set head's pan/tilt to the given values..
message.field: Time in seconds when to reach the target.

message.name: SetStiffnessParams
message.comment: Updates Stiffness values for a certain motion pattern
